Melbourne bot. Garden,

It affords me much pleasure, dear Mr Manners-Sutton, to send 4 Pines for the auspicious purpose of being entrusted to the ground by H.R.H. I send the largest Libanon Cedar which I had available in the nursery. It is nearly two years old, the tree being slow of growth. To lift a larger one from any of the lawns would be precarious and take more time than would at a moments notice be available. The three other pines are all species from Her Majesty's possessions.

Pinus Taeda, is a native of the South of Canada, where it is called the Loblolly Fir. It attains a hight of rather more than 100'.
100 feet. It is one of the noblest of all Firs. Pinus (Abies) Webbiana is one of the most magnificent of all Himalaian Spruces. At [Butan], 12-13000' high, it forms the Main-forest. It is the Raisalla-or Chilran-Pine.
Of Araucaria Cunninghami of N. S. Wales and Queensland I selected a grey variety of great rarity.

While presenting my homage to the Prince, I beg to observe, that the Saxono-Gothaea conspicua of Patagonia and the Pinus Alberti of Mexico and California, kindly planted as memorial trees by H.R.H. last year in the botanic Garden of Melbourne, have well grown and are verdant.
